data.title: Nice experience.
data.text:
Visited with some friends earlier this month. Their staff was very nice. I got an order of house dumplings, as well as a normal bubble tea. The house dumplings were pretty good: I liked the taste, but the consistency wasn't really my cup of tea. Speaking of tea, the bubble tea they made was probably the third best I've had in the US: they make the strength just right, and they do a great job with the bubbles. 
Be warned, they do not take cards on weekends. If you forget cash, there's an ATM in a diner across the parking lot (you'll see it, and the staff can help you find it).
TL;DR: great staff, great food, great bubble tea, don't forget cash on weekends

data.title: Good service but my dumplings were average
data.text: My experience here was ok but nothing to brag about their food.  I ordered the house dumplings and pork spare rib noodle soup. The dumpligs were a bit dry in comparison to other dumpling house restaurants I have visited. The pork and meat ratio inside the dumplings was good. As for the soup, it was tasty and contained a great portion of noodles and spare ribs but not enough soup. I asked the waitress if they can add a bit more soup and she kindly fullfilled my request.  Unfortunately,  the soup was a bit more diluted with hot water than it was originally served with a more flavorful taste. I appreciate the kindness or our waitress but wish i could compliment the food a bit more. More so the ambiance is nice for couples but not so much for big groups. Its a tight space but nicely decorated so perfect for a small family.

data.title: First time and loved it!!
data.text: The restaurant is very small, but we went on a Friday night later in the evening and were able to be seated quickly. The menu is large, and more descriptions of the dishes would have helped first time goers like us, but all of the food we ended up ordering was fantastic! The food was very authentic Chinese, not just your typical carryout, and it also seemed to lean more towards Szechuan style, as the dishes didn't seem to have a ton of cornstarch or overly thick sauces. We tried some of their dumplings, as well as dandan noodles, and their chicken and broccoli, and all three were delicious as well as modestly priced. We also were able to describe a classical Chinese dish that we wanted to our waitress, and although the dish was not on the menu, they made it for us and it turned out wonderfully! The dumplings took some time to come out, but everything else we ordered was prepared and brought to us very quickly. Overall, even though the restaurant was small, the great food, good prices, and fast service completely made up for it!

data.title: Really enjoyed East Dumpling!
data.text: Very efficient service.  Lots of dumpling choices cooked two ways. We went with the steamed house dumpling and chicken dumplings and were very pleased.  The lamb kebab appetizer was delicious.  Ordered a large hot+sour soup for the table.  Just the right amount of kick.  The dandan noodles were homemade and delicious.  Different and excellent take on combination fried rice.  Definitely worth a visit if you're in Rockville.

data.title: Good dumplings
data.text: The Food is good.  I've only done take out and would like to eat in, but the place is very, very small. Just want to see how much better they taste right out of the kitchen.  Lots of dumplings to pick from.

data.title: Nothing dumpy about East Dumpling House
data.text: We wanted to have dumplings and reviewed the places with the highest ratings. East Dumpling House did not disappoint. We had pork dumplings with chives and shrimp dumplings with chives. We also had the Dandan noodles, spicy tofu and the usual Hot and Sour soup. The food was simply delicious and the portions were generous. You definitely get value for the money, though don't expect a great atmosphere. This is a cross between authentic home cooking and fast food.

data.title: Great Dumplings Served with a Smile
data.text: Great dumpling restaurant and more. Quick, friendly service.This cozy restaurant tucked in to shopping plaza near downtown Rockville has a surprisingly large menu. They don't take reservations, and a line forms outside, but I've never waited long to be seated. Highlights for me: Dumplings - both meat and veggie assortments. Cold eggplant appetizer. Cold cucumber appetizer. BBQ lamb on skewer. Mapo Dofu. I've seen Shui Zhu Yu (fish in chili oil), but have yet to order it here.

data.title: East Dumpling House for Dinner
data.text:
After mom and my cousin spent the weekend with us in Alexandria Virginia, we took mom and Sandra to East Dumpling House for dinner before dropping them off to get Sandra's car so they can go back to their own homes.

The restaurant is very small. The service was okay. The food was okay.

We ordered three kinds of dumplings and some dishes. Can't remember what we ordered.

I would try the restaurant again but without my mom. Mom was not impressed.

data.title: OK - but - - -
data.text: The most essential comment is that the food is good. The ambiance is a little lacking, with tables a bit squeezed in. The menu has a good selection of dishes, including terrific dumplings, kabobs (!), interesting side salads (dried tofu, cucumber, and potato). The prices are moderate - and apparently have recently gone up, as the menu has several taped over new prices. One oddity is that the restrooms are not in the restaurant, but rather in the adjacent lobby of the building the restaurant is located. Will I come back again? Yes, if I am in the neighborhood - but No if I am not! The parking lot is a pay lot, but they do validate your ticket for two free hours.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: We had read good things about this restaurant on Trip Advisor, but it didn't live up to them last night. The dumplings were mediocre and the beef skewers were overspiced and fatty. We will go to China Bistro instead.

data.title: Great food, very cheap
data.text: This place is a fabulous hole in the wall.  We usually get the boiled dumplings -- either chicken mushroom and / or beef celery.  I also love the homemade noodles with bean sauce.  The hot and sour soup is delicious, with lots of bamboo shoots.  However, you might have to ask them to warm it up.  (It was room temperature last time I ordered it.)  Service varies depending on how busy the restaurant is.  Parking is free for about 1.5 hours.  Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Dumplings not as good as before
data.text: We've been to East Dumpling House several times and have always liked their dumplings. They are the only place we know of that sells lamb dumplings. We went this past weekend and got 3 orders of dumplings: fish, lamb, and shrimp+chives. Unlike our previous visits, the dumplings we got this time really weren't very good. Each shimp+chives dumpling contained a couple small shrimp and coarsely chopped chives. The lamb dumplings had undercooked shredded carrots. The fish dumplings were mostly pork with a small amount of fish and coarsely chopped green onions mixed in. We'll stick to China Bistro for dumplings.

data.title: Excellent small plates
data.text: Our group of Five included two from Taipei, one from Shanghai, one ABC, and one American husband, who all cook Chinese food. We began with a nice selection of cold appetizers of which only the pickles we would not order again. Then several orders of boiled dumplings of different kinds, all worth a return trip. Then two unusual stewed tofu dishes. Then stir fried greens, done just right. Well recommended, just don't expect lemon chicken.

data.title: Tasty
data.text: Really enjoyed our experience here. The food was very tasty. The dumplings were outstanding peach smoothie Yum Yum. Definitely, will be back. Enjoy

data.title: Horrible Service & Mediocre Food
data.text:
I was staying at a nearby hotel and felt like a quick Chinese dinner tonight. Alas, I made the mistake of picking this particular establishment.

The service is just outright horrible. As I entered, I was looking for a nice table. 3 of the tables by the entrance were dirty and not cleaned. What kind of impression does this make on new guests? Anyway, I was hungry and waited for the waitress to take me to a clean table on the other side of the restaurant.

So I sat down, and studied the menu. Ice tea, hot & sour soup and a bunch of shrimp chive dumplings should do the trick. How bad can it be, I thought...Oh well, I waited 10 minutes for the soup to arrive. 5 minutes I got my ice tea. 

The soup was ok. The dumplings were rather dry and tasteless. An ice tea that was served in a plastic cup to drown my sorrows. Not terrible, but just not good either. $17.70 down the drain.

Service was slow and clueless. They mixed up a bunch of orders at other tables, didn't see me waive to ask for my bill.

I left a $1 tip to hopefully send a message that they need to improve. 

Go elsewhere.

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: Kids saw this when we stopped at the nearby Subway, so we came back for lunch the next day.  Portions are huge (12 dumplings) and great variety and value for the money. I would go back to try the soups and noodle dishes - they looked delicious!

data.title: Casual eatery with interesting dishes
data.text: This place was recommended by some friends so we all went to dinner on a Sunday evening. It's in a small mall in Rockville town center, there is parking in front and restaurant will validate up to two hours.  The dining room is not big (seats around 30-40 with a communal long table in the middle and seats for mostly 4 on two sides)  and fairly nicely decorated with Chinese accents such as rows of little red lanterns.  And with glass walls on two sides there is a lot of light and didn't feel as cramped as it otherwise would be. We got there just after 7 and had to wait a bit for a table, and it stayed packed even as we finished up.  The diners were about 80% Chinese, majority quite young.  Food was billed to be Northeastern Chinese style and the owner was indeed from Harbin. Noodles are handmade so they stick together a bit, but the flavor was good.  There's an extensive menu for dumplings with a variety of fillings.  We had the chicken mushroom filling and it was very good, just the right size and quite delicate, skin not too thick.  The cumin beef was quite tender, and if you like stuff cooked in soups (more Sichuan style than Northeastern) there's a large selection of that as well.  Not a lot of vegetable dishes but the green beans were well done and delicious.  It actually had the atmosphere of a regional restaurant in a small Chinese town. A bit messy (after all, not a fancy restaurant), what with all the soupy and saucy dishes, and the condiments jars and bottles on the table are not squeaky clean to the touch.  But if you could overlook all that, it is possible to have a tasty and filling meal for a very reasonable price (it averaged around $15 per person for us before tip).  And overall,  the menu is more interesting than your run of the mill Chinese restaurant in the DC area.  Too bad this is a bit out of the way for us, otherwise would definitely be a place worth repeated visits.

data.title: Great Dumplings!
data.text:
If you want a comfort meal, this is the place! We had several varieties of dumplings (and a few side dishes), and everything was excellent. They make the dumplings fresh as soon as you place your order, and they have a wonderful selection! 

The dumplings come out with about 10 in an order. I had dinner with three other people; we each chose a dumpling variety and one side dish. It was more than enough for everyone to leave stuffed! The service was good (please allow some extra time for your freshly made dumplings!), and the location is excellent (located beside Rockville Town Center). 

I've eaten in the restaurant and gotten take out (again, even for take out, the dumplings are freshly made!). It's a small restaurant, and I don't believe they take reservations. There's outdoor seating available as well, expanding the footprint a bit. If you don't want to feel too crowded, go on a weeknight or show up before or after the dinner rush. But these dumpings are definitely worth the wait!

The best part (other than delicious dumplings) is that it's extremely affordable. My party of four ordered four orders of dumplings and four sides (I don't recall ordering any alcoholic beverages), and we ended up with a $55 tab.

data.title: Getting better all the time
data.text:
This is a corner spot just a block from Rockville Town Center.  The whole area has some really good Asian restaurants, but this one, which I thought of as just a dumpling spot is much better than that and really worth a visit.  They are proud of all their home made noodles and I found them really good, although the first few times in I just had the dumplings.
Their skewered lamb, for example, is quite a bargain and very flavorable.

data.title: Delicious, Authentic dumplings
data.text: We spotted this place on a Friday night and couldn't have been happier with our experience. Dumpling made fresh-to-order ...We ordered two huge plates of chicken and mushroom and the House dumplings, both were divine. We also ordered lamb kebab skewers with low mein. This is a no-frills joint with a just a few tables but lots of satisfied customers. My husband liked it so much he wanted to return the next day! Tired of all the trendy places opening in DC, we were thrilled to find this authentic place in downtown Rockville.
